You are given a string $S$ of length $n$ made up of the first $m$ lowercase English letters.  Find the number of different strings $T$ of length $n$ made up of the first $m$ lowercase English letters such that the length of the longest common subsequence between $S$ and $T$ is $n-1$. 

The longest common subsequence of two strings is the longest string that is a subsequence of both strings.

You are given a string of length *n*.  Find the number of strings of the same length that can be made using only a set of *m* lowercase letters, where the longest common subsequence between the original string and the new string is one less than the length of the string.
